MajorClaims.MC1: the juries should at least know something about the criminals before coming to a conclusion
MajorClaims.MC2: the current way of the juries judging the case should be transformed and they should know the facts about the criminals they are dealing with

Claims.C1: they will be able to give a better and reliable as well as a fair judgment to the convicted
Claims.C2: it would be easier for the juries to make a decision if they know about the past information about the criminal
Claims.C3: the convicted will also receive a fair action
Claims.C4: when the background of the convicted is 'dug' deeper and is revealed to mass of anonymous people, his privacy is being jeopardized

Premises.P1: knowing their background very well will enable the juries to analyze the crime before coming up with a judgment
Premises.P2: take a person who has not murdered anyone but is suddenly found to be guilty
Premises.P3: The juries will be able to know weather the individual committed the crime intentionally or due to circumstances by knowing the facts about the person
Premises.P4: punishment can be given in accordance to the condition
Premises.P5: exposing them to the past records of the criminal can give them more room to think rationally and finally put the pieces together in order to produce a more meaningful decision
Premises.P6: the juries will have a sense of relief that they have come up with better conclusion based on plenty of evidences
Premises.P7: juries are a group of people who have no or less knowledge regarding law
Premises.P8: a fair trial can be achieved
Premises.P9: If finally he is proven innocent, he may feel embarrassed to face the public
Premises.P10: the crimes done by criminals should be brought to light and the public should be aware of it so that they will not become a victim as well
